title: What does the final keyword do in Java?

answers.junior: final makes variables constant, methods non-overridable, and classes non-inheritable. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: final variables can be assigned once, final methods prevent overriding, final classes prevent extension. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Enables compiler optimizations and immutability patterns.
answers.senior: final provides compile-time guarantees for immutability, enables safe publication in concurrent contexts, and allows JVM optimizations. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Blank finals initialized in constructors.
answers.tricky: Discuss effectively final (lambda capturing), final on method parameters, final vs immutability, and performance implications. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
